episodes.title: All Cults Are Not Created Equal
episodes.description:
All cults are not created equal. From the wide array of beliefs they teach, to the variety of people who are involved, cults are as different from each other as are officially recognized religions.


Support the show: http://www.wnpr.org/donate


See omnystudio.com/listener (https://omnystudio.com/listener)  for privacy information.

episodes.title: Brainwashing: From the Korean War to cults to today
episodes.description:
The term “brainwashing” has been used throughout history by scientists, politicians, and journalists, as well as in movies and literature.
 

This hour: a look at the history and science of brainwashing.
 

GUESTS:
 
      
  •  Joel Dimsdale: Distinguished professor emeritus in the department of psychiatry at University of California San Diego and the author of Dark Persuasion: A History of Brainwashing from Pavlov to Social Media (https://yalebooks.yale.edu/book/9780300247176/dark-persuasion/) 
      
  •  Timothy Melley: Professor of English at Miami University
       

The Colin McEnroe Show is available as a podcast on Apple Podcasts (https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-colin-mcenroe-show/id714179884) , Spotify (https://open.spotify.com/show/0AXtqrzWounIoJyIqz003p?si=89RJodkWRsOo1dck5BCdMA&nd=1) , Google Podcasts (https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cub21ueWNvbnRlbnQuY29tL2QvcGxheWxpc3QvYWMwYmU5NjktZDdkZi00NjBjLWE2NmMtYTZmOTAwZTFlYmQxLzcxZGM0YTBmLWU4Y2EtNDAyMS1hZWM5LWFhMDMwMDI2MDQyZC9iNjk1Y2I4Ny1mNmE5LTRjNzYtOGYxMS1hYTAzMDAyNjA0M2IvcG9kY2FzdC5yc3M) , Stitcher (https://www.stitcher.com/show/colin-mcenroe-show-rsspodcast) , or wherever you get your podcasts. Subscribe and never miss an episode!
 

Join the conversation on Facebook (https://facebook.com/ColinMcShow)  and Twitter (https://twitter.com/colinmcshow) .
 

Colin McEnroe, Jonathan McNicol, Cat Pastor, and Dylan Reyes contributed to this show, which originally aired April 20, 2022.
 

Our programming is made possible thanks to listeners like you. Please consider supporting this show and Connecticut Public with a donation today (https://www.ctpublic.org/donate) .

episodes.title: The Nose looks at the glut of cult docuseries
episodes.description:
Cult documentaries and docuseries sure seem to be having a moment right now (https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/why-are-we-suddenly-all-obsessed-with-cults_uk_6481d381e4b04ee51a92f3ec) . (On the other hand. (https://www.pacificsandiego.com/arts-culture/tv/story/2020-05-28/waco-wild-wild-country-cult-tv-shows) ) This isn’t the sort of material The Nose usually gets into. But, and partly inspired by Cat’s Corner in the current edition of The Noseletter (https://secure.ctpublic.org/page/email/message/view?templateId=278660) , we decided to give three popular new shows a look:
 

Escaping Twin Flames is a three-part Netflix docuseries that looks at the controversial online community Twin Flames Universe.
 

The Garden: Commune or Cult is a six-part Discovery Channel docuseries about the off-the-grid community The Garden.
 

And Love Has Won: The Cult of Mother God is a three-part HBO docuseries that looks at the life and death of Amy Carlson, also known as Mother God.
 

Some other stuff that happened this week, give or take:
 
      
  •  André Braugher Dies: Star Of ‘Homicide: Life On The Street’, ‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ & Other Series And Films Was 61 (https://deadline.com/2023/12/andre-braugher-dead-homicide-life-on-the-street-brooklyn-nine-nine-actor-1235665513/) 
      
  •  Golden Globe Nominations: ‘Barbie’, ‘Oppenheimer’ Top Movie List; ‘Succession’ Leads Way In TV (https://deadline.com/2023/12/golden-globe-nominations-2024-1235660995/) 
      
  •  The Year Twitter Died (https://www.theverge.com/c/23972308/twitter-x-death-tweets-history-elon-musk) 
      
  •  Nicolas Cage Says He’s Almost Finished: “Three or Four More Movies Left” (https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/nicolas-cage-retiring-movies-acting-1235709589/)  The famously prolific 59-year-old actor says he’s eyeing a Hollywood endgame: “I’ve said what I’ve had to say with cinema.”
      
  •  ‘Curb Your Enthusiasm’ Officially Ending With Season 12 at HBO (https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/curb-your-enthusiasm-ending-season-12-hbo-larry-david-1235755299/)  “I will now have the opportunity to finally shed this ‘Larry David’ persona and become the person God intended me to be,” David says of ending his HBO comedy.
      
  •  The New Yorker Drops Andy Borowitz’s Satire Column Amid Cutbacks (https://variety.com/2023/digital/news/new-yorker-drops-andy-borowitz-cutbacks-1235824249/) 
      
  •  How ‘Mr. Brightside’ Became a Generation’s Anthem (https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/06/arts/music/mr-brightside-killers.html)  Overlooked at its release, the Killers’ signature hit has become one of the most inescapable rock songs of its time.
      
  •  A 25-Year-Old X-Files Mystery Was Solved on Twitter in Less Than 24 Hours (https://www.tor.com/2023/12/06/a-25-year-old-x-files-mystery-was-solved-on-twitter-in-less-than-24-hours/) 
      
  •  24 Things That Stuck With Us in 2023 (https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/09/arts/movies-tv-art-music-2023.html)  Films, TV shows, albums, books, art and A.I.-generated SpongeBob performances that reporters, editors and visual journalists in Culture couldn’t stop thinking about this year.
      
  •  The Most Egregious Example of “We Didn’t Use CGI” Mythology (So Far) (http://fxrant.blogspot.com/2023/12/the-most-egregious-example-of-we-didnt.html) 
      
  •  Strapped, stressed, axed: is it curtains for theatre’s artistic directors? (https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2023/dec/13/axed-theatres-artistic-directors-indhu-rubasingham-national)  Indhu Rubasingham has been named as the National’s new head. But elsewhere, theatres are ditching this once coveted role altogether. Can a theatre really manage without one?
       

GUESTS:
 
      
  •  Sam Hatch: Co-hosts The Culture Dogs on Sunday nights on WWUH
      
  •  Jacques Lamarre: A playwright and chief communications officer at Buzz Engine
      
  •  Carolyn Paine: An actress, comedian, and dancer; she is founder, director, and choreographer of CONNetic Dance
      
  •  Cat Pastor: Assistant radio operations manager at Connecticut Public
       

The Colin McEnroe Show is available as a podcast on Apple Podcasts (https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-colin-mcenroe-show/id714179884) , Spotify (https://open.spotify.com/show/0AXtqrzWounIoJyIqz003p) , Google Podcasts (https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cub21ueWNvbnRlbnQuY29tL2QvcGxheWxpc3QvYWMwYmU5NjktZDdkZi00NjBjLWE2NmMtYTZmOTAwZTFlYmQxLzcxZGM0YTBmLWU4Y2EtNDAyMS1hZWM5LWFhMDMwMDI2MDQyZC9iNjk1Y2I4Ny1mNmE5LTRjNzYtOGYxMS1hYTAzMDAyNjA0M2IvcG9kY2FzdC5yc3M) , Amazon Music (https://music.amazon.com/podcasts/9b6b3cee-f69b-4729-a78b-181f851d80e8/the-colin-mcenroe-show) , TuneIn (https://tunein.com/podcasts/News--Politics-Podcasts/The-Colin-McEnroe-Show-p1208473/) , Listen Notes (https://www.listennotes.com/podcasts/the-colin-mcenroe-show-connecticut-public-lXR08dxQSM5/) , or wherever you get your podcasts.
